dct_description_sm: Gerardi Mercatoris à I. Hondio plurimis æneis tabulis auctus atque illustratus ; Amsterodami: excusum in ædibus Iudoci Hondii, veneunt etiam apud Corneliū Nicolai, item apud Ioannem Ianßoniū Arnhemi.
Indexes: Index tabularum hujus operis sive descriptionum earundem; Index tabula rum Galliæ; Secundum Membrum est Principum Virorum & Nobilium.
Engraved title page; head and tail-pieces throughout.
Decorative cartouches, bar scales, compass roses, rhumb lines, ships, sea monsters.
Maps show topography, vegetation, waterways, shoals, ports, city plans.
In addition to title cartouches, maps stamped with titles at top.
Map 47 has coat of arms; Map 156 has seals.
Map 152 has pictorial representation of Adam and Eve.

Some differences between titles within cartouches and titles above maps; descriptive text sometimes contains elaborate titles listing place names included in maps, e.g. Map 21: Angliæ IIII tabula, in qua hi sunt comitatus, Cornubia, Devonia, Somersetus, Dorcestria, Wiltonia, Glocestria, Monumetha, Glamorgan, Caermarden, Penbrock, Cardigan, Radnor, Brecnoke, Herefordia & Vigornia.
dct_rights_sm: Images from the The Renaissance Exploration Collection courtesy Stanford University Libraries. This item is in the public domain. There are no restrictions on use. If you have questions, please contact the David Rumsey Map Center at rumseymapcenter@stanford.edu.
